Plot the pdf_detect_clusters() Object

Source: R/pdf_plot_clusters.R
pdf_plot_clusters.Rd

This function plots the clusters that are detected using the pdf_detect_clusters() function. Each cluster is assigned a unique color and number, making them easy to visually detect and compare with the original PDF.

The function works on both a single page (as a list item from the result of pdf_detect_clusters()) and a list of pages (the entire output of pdf_detect_clusters()). When applied to a list of pages, the function returns a list of ggplot2 objects, one for each page.

This flexibility allows users to visualize clusters for specific pages or for the entire document.

Usage

pdf_plot_clusters(pdf_data_clusters)

Arguments

pdf_data_clusters

A single list item from the result of pdf_detect_clusters(), or the full list of pages returned by pdf_detect_clusters().

Value

A ggplot2 rectangle plot when applied to a single page. When applied to a list of pages, a list of ggplot2 rectangle plots is returned.

Examples

# Example for a single page
npo[[12]] |>
  pdf_detect_clusters() |>
  pdf_plot_clusters()


# Example for a list of pages
npo |>
  head(3) |>
  pdf_detect_clusters() |>
  pdf_plot_clusters()
#> [[1]]

#> 
#> [[2]]

#> 
#> [[3]]

#>
